title: Masters of Sex series logo font
content:
Does anybody know what serif font is being used in this logo?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153055im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kHtpI_6216.jpg)
author: firsthelix

comments.content:
Best match I could find is Encorpada (the M, A, and R would need to be customized):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dootype/encorpada-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153055/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dootype/encorpada-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dootype/encorpada-pro/")

\_MASTERS OF SEX\_ is a fairly close match to the similarly named "Lust" [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153055/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/") \_R\_ seems pretty well spot on. Use the leg from \_R\_ for the strokes on \_M\_ and \_A\_. Use the Didone version of Lust.  
I suspect that \_MASTERS OF SEX\_ is not a specific font as such, but rather is yet another attempt to make a sexy set of Didone letters.  
Don

I spoke to soon. It appears to be an adaptation of a free font called Nouvelle Vague by Dirk Schuster:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/nouvelle-vague.font?text=MASTERS+OF+SEX&psize=l](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153055/http:/www.dafont.com/nouvelle-vague.font?text=MASTERS+OF+SEX&psize=l "http://www.dafont.com/nouvelle-vague.font?text=MASTERS+OF+SEX&psize=l")  
 [http://www.bropix.de/index.php?/graphic/nouvelle-vague-font/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153055/http:/www.bropix.de/index.php?/graphic/nouvelle-vague-font/ "http://www.bropix.de/index.php?/graphic/nouvelle-vague-font/")

Good find Kevin. So this attempt to make a sexy set of Didone letters actually resulted in a font. A student project that made it into the commercial world.  
Don
Let's hope they paid for a commercial use of the font, or at least gave Dirk credit. There's talk that they ripped off the overturned E from another designer....
